titleStmt.title: Description of A collection of kabbalistic treatises.

availability.licence: This metadata, accompanying images, and the content of London, British Library, Oriental Manuscripts Add MS 27064: A collection of kabbalistic treatises. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Zero 1.0 Universal page for usage details, https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/.

Given the importance of the historical record, and the fact that that some of our digitised collections include materials that are sensitive to particular communities and groups, we ask that any use of the digitised collections is undertaken with the appropriate care. Irrespective of its copyright status, items and/or collections should not be altered or used in ways that might be derogatory to the originating individuals or communities. notesStmt.note: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msItem.title: Or yaḳar (Saba de-mishpaṭim) אור יקר (סבא דמשפטים)
Shemu῾ah be-῾inyan ha-gilgul שמועה בענין הגלגול
Teshuvah ῾al ῾eser sefirot תשובה על עשר ספירות
Perush sefer ha-῾iyun פרוש ספר העיון
Ma῾aseh bereshit rabah מעשה בראשית רבה
Zohar ḥadash (Midrash Shir ha-shirim) זהר חדש (מדרש שיר השירים)

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive script of the 16th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Moses Cordovero. Or Yakar. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,064.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 169: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, [272v] (fse005v).
